formattedAddress: 175 W 90th St, New York, NY 10024, USA
adrFormatAddress: 175 W 90th St, New York, NY 10024, USA

originalText.text: Steve is one of the best piano teachers I've ever worked with. He got where I was coming from right away - which is that I wanted to learn jazz improvisation in a professional but playful manner -and suited his teaching to my sensibility. His knowledge and musicality are profound and I couldn't recommend him more highly.

originalText.text:
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

Steve has all the qualities I was looking for in a piano teacher. He’s a brilliant pianist with a great “piano side manner” friendly, fun and encouraging.
I was comfortable with him from my first lesson.
Working with Steve has given me the motivation and confidence I’ve never had. Look no further.

originalText.text: Remarkable. Steven is one of those mentors who we might remember as having inspired and fed our playful and creative impulses. He teaches with joyously structured intuition, creating a class with multiple facets moving flawlessly from structured to an improvisational blast. Thanks Steven!

text.text: Remarkable. Steven is one of those mentors who we might remember as having inspired and fed our playful and creative impulses. He teaches with joyously structured intuition, creating a class with multiple facets moving flawlessly from structured to an improvisational blast. Thanks Steven!

originalText.text: Steve is an excellent teacher who injects joy and erudition into every lesson.  His holistic approach combines breathing, stretching and rhythm exercises as well as singing and improvisation to encourage the student's confidence and relaxation at the piano.  He weaves in fun tidbits of piano theory and examples from classical, jazz, Latin and other pieces.  He won't let you forget that the goal is to enrich your life with music.

text.text: Steve is an excellent teacher who injects joy and erudition into every lesson.  His holistic approach combines breathing, stretching and rhythm exercises as well as singing and improvisation to encourage the student's confidence and relaxation at the piano.  He weaves in fun tidbits of piano theory and examples from classical, jazz, Latin and other pieces.  He won't let you forget that the goal is to enrich your life with music.

originalText.text: I studied with Steve for a over a year and I couldn’t be happier with my decision to do so. He’s patient and knowledgeable and helps me improve on the pieces and type of music that I’m actually interested in playing, rather than what one “should” know. Our hour together flies by even if we’re working on drilling or the tiniest minutiae of music theory. My playing has improved measurably and I credit Steve’s his ability to help me focus on technique that can be applied to any type of piece or style one could be interested in. I would not hesitate to recommend Steve to a friend and am excited to be able to continue to work together.
